channel.title: More character space in signatures
channel.description:
I think 200 isn't enough, i think 300-400 would be appropriate. I don't think signatures should contain images or anything (makes forum look messy) and i don't think signatures should be too big. But i think the charecter count of the signatures is not high enough, theres not enough room for like extensive bb code? Pros/cons? Discuss?
ALTERNATIVE: I'm not sure if this is possible, but how about the bb code not count as a character? (anything within the brackets).

item.title: More character space in signatures
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

I think he meant the actual tag shouldn’t take space, so whilst [b] and [ /b] shouldn’t take up space, everything inside them should.

(Making this:

[b]Hello.[/b]

Only take up 6 characters instead of 13.

Read full topic

item.title: More character space in signatures
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:44, topic:379180”]How about this:

Minimum posts: 1000
this rules out a shitload of people.
Minimum time here: 1 year
proves you’re not a spammer
Maximum sig size: 40 Y axis, 120 X axis
Allows for small sigs, simple reads

Once you’ve achieved these, go make your sig (with the pic in bb code) and there will be a button saying “submit to moderator”. It will send it to a mod, and they can approve or disapprove your signature. Because of the requirements, obviously a lot less people will have sigs.
Also, for some special conditions (veteran, community member, ect.) who don’t have the above requirements, may still be able to get a signature with a picture.[/quote]

That would cause people to spam to get to 1000, there is no way to enforce size requirements except with html tags, which load the full image even if it’s 4096x2048, and the staff is already over-worked as it is, the last thing we need is to have to approve hundreds of signatures a day, also nothing could stop you from changing it later, as the sigs are hosted off-site.

And it makes the site look unprofessional and cluttered.

Read full topic

item.title: More character space in signatures
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:47, topic:379180”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=475030.msg3474665#msg3474665 date=1295579260]

MITB is a redneck, you can’t change his opinion.

This legit made me laugh.
I would put it in my sig, but it appears I don’t have enough space.
[/quote]

Take off another part of your signature then.[/quote]

Why?
My sig is fine.

It shows I’m lucky, and my tutorial has helped noobs. who have personally pmed me.

Read full topic

item.title: More character space in signatures
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

How about this:

Minimum posts: 1000
this rules out a shitload of people.
Minimum time here: 1 year
proves you’re not a spammer
Maximum sig size: 40 Y axis, 120 X axis
Allows for small sigs, simple reads

Once you’ve achieved these, go make your sig (with the pic in bb code) and there will be a button saying “submit to moderator”. It will send it to a mod, and they can approve or disapprove your signature. Because of the requirements, obviously a lot less people will have sigs.
Also, for some special conditions (veteran, community member, ect.) who don’t have the above requirements, may still be able to get a signature with a picture.

item.title: More character space in signatures
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:40, topic:379180”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=475030.msg3474432#msg3474432 date=1295566029]
No on the image in the signatures, for the millionth time, it makes the forum look unprofessional, and would be a nightmare to moderate inappropriate images. I’m not doing it ever. Period.
[/quote]

So not even for players who maybe have like an “x” number of posts, who have been here for “x” long, the picture can only be “x” by “x” large, no .gif, and you must make a submission of that picture to a mod, and they can approve that image and the person is allowed to use that image and only that image unless re-approved with a different picture.[/quote]
That sounds quite simple to you, but will definitely add quite a few pounds of bricks to the staff members’ work load. Also, as he stated, it really will make the forum look unprofessional and messy.

Read full topic
